intro: Sida troyana, commonly known as the common mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pale pink or white flowers. Its fruit is a dry capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Sida troyana is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
